edu.uncc.cs.bridges

Class Vertex<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uncc.cs.bridges.AbstractVertex<T>
      • edu.uncc.cs.bridges.Vertex<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractVertex<T>>

    public class Vertex<T>
extends AbstractVertex<T>
    An implementation of AbstractVertex with HashMap for adjacency.

      This method returns the next unvisited edge from the current vertex's list of emerging edges if the list is empty (no edges) it returns null if the method is called repeatedly one can iterate, one edge at a time, through the entire list of existing edges

      • createEdge

        public AbstractEdge<T> createEdge(Vertex<T> v2,
                         double weight)
        Creates an edge between the calling vertex and a passed vertex. It attaches the weight attribute to an Edge
        Parameters:
        v2 - The second vertex that edge is between.
        weight - Contains the weight value as a double

      • createEdge

        public AbstractEdge<T> createEdge(Vertex<T> v2,
                         java.lang.String randWeight)
        Creates an edge between the calling vertex and a passed vertex. It attaches the weight attribute to an Edge and assigns it a random value
        Parameters:
        v2 - The second vertex that edge is between.
        weight - Contains the weight value as a string "randWeight", later transformed in a random double between 0.0-9.0

      • getEdge

        Returns the Edge between two Vertices.
        Parameters:
        v2 - The second vertex.
        Returns:
        The associated Edge.

      • next

        public AbstractVertex<T> next(int anIndex)
        This method returns the next child of the current vertex as specified by the index integer value if the index value is above or below the number of children vertices it returns null
        Parameters:
        anIndex - represents the index of the child vertex
        Returns:
        AbstractVertex

      • next

        public AbstractVertex<T> next()
        This method returns the next child of the current vertex If no children nodes are present it returns null it also keeps track of the last next() method call and returns the following child
        Returns:
        AbstractVertex representing the next child of the currrent vertex

      • setColor

        public Vertex<T> setColor(java.lang.String color)
        Description copied from class: AbstractVertex
        Set the color, according to CSS formats. By default, the color will be chosen at random. Setting the color to null or "" resets to defaults.
        Overrides:
        setColor in class AbstractVertex<T>
        Parameters:
        color - Color as a String
        See Also:

      • nextEdge

        public AbstractEdge<T> nextEdge()
        This method returns the next unvisited edge from the current vertex's list of emerging edges if the list is empty (no edges) it returns null if the method is called repeatedly one can iterate, one edge at a time, through the entire list of existing edges
        Returns:
